cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Cuba, then expected to enter the southeastern Gulf Monday night, turn northwest, and approach the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA border region) late Wednesday into early Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast, near the TX/LA border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches confined to portions of the central Bahamas and the Florida Keys (Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for Haiti, the northern Dominican Republic coast, the Turks & Caicos, southeastern–western Cuba and adjacent isles
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles today–Monday; Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana expected mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible by late Wednesday with a peak 19% onset probability and 26% cumulative chance over five days
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the mid-Texas coast if the center tracks closer than currently forecast
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, producing flooding concerns in and around Lavaca and Matagorda Bays
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and higher-than-normal tides could halt vessel movements and cargo operations
